urquoise was generally found in the more arid locations around Toril.
This ornamental stone was an opaque blue to greenish-blue, and usually occurred with blotches of darker hues in the mix.  A typical stone had a base value of 10 gp, except during the Spellplague era when the value jumped to 100 gp.
Turquoise stones were considered sacred by followers of Aerdrie Faenya and Erevan Ilesere&mdashappropriate for sacrifice, or to be consecrated for use, or recognized as boons or omens when found.
Elves valued the pure color stones (without the darker mottling) It was also used as a good luck charm by horsemen who would put a small shard of turquoise in their horses harnessAccording to Elminster, this was the interval from 445 am to 515 am. was the best time of day to apply an immersion containing turquoise.
